taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe cardueae;genus cirsium;species pumilum;variety pumilum

taxon_name.authority: (Muhlenberg ex W. P. C. Barton) Petrak

bio:treatment.description: Plants mostly 30–100 cm; branches 3–5+, long. Roots usually slender, not or rarely slightly tuberous-thickened. Leaves usually lobed nearly to midveins, sinuses deep, U-shaped, main spines ± stout, 3–7 mm. Heads 5.5–6 cm. Phyllaries: outer 3–5 mm wide at base, spines stout, 3–6 mm. Corollas usually 40–45 mm. Cypselae usually 3.5–4 mm. 2n = 30.
Conn., Del., Maine, Md., Mass., N.H., N.J., N.Y., N.C., Ohio, Pa., R.I., S.C., Vt., Va., W.Va.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety pumilum grows on the Atlantic coastal plain from Maine to South Carolina and ranges inland to Pennsylvania and Ohio. It is known to hybridize with Cirsium horridulum var. horridulum (R. J. Moore and C. Frankton 1966).
